intro: Psychotria chrysocarpa, commonly known as the golden fruit psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded forest understories. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to yellowish flowers. Its fruit is a fleshy, yellowish drupe that contains several seeds. Psychotria chrysocarpa is of interest to botanists and ecologists due to its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
